Blog.post: So I went to the movies with my sister tonight. Even though we'd just eaten supper, we stopped to get candy at Target and then proceeded to get popcorn and nachos at the concession stand. Of course, the Diet Coke (which has no calories) I drank cancelled those things out. (Don't I wish.) Why is it impossible to bypass things like popcorn and candy at the movies, even if I am not hungry? Why is it, when I am watching the movie I find my hand constantly moving back and forth between my mouth and the popcorn? This morning I ate cereal at work. I ate Lucky Charms with 2% milk. Did you know Lucky Charms has fewer calories than Cinnamon Toast Crunch? I was going to have soup for lunch, and indeed, I had several spoonfuls, but I was emotionally upset about something so I couldn't finish. Finally: I am upset and not eating. Usually when I am upset I have to eat. Not that I want to be upset, it is just bound to happen. Of course, I made up for not having lunch by chowing at the theater.

OK so this is not my first blog, but this is in addition to "Happy, Just a Little Flustered" which can be found urlLink here . This is going to be my weight loss or "wellness" blog. Whatever. So I am a fat ass and I know it. I am 5'4" and weigh about 210#. I hate the way I look, I hate the way I look and feel in my clothes. I hate buying bigger clothes. I hate having to shop at the fat girl store. I hate not wearing the cute stuff I want to wear. I don't want to have health problems now or ever. I don't want to look like my mother when I am her age. I hate not eating what I want when I want. This week I was pretty good. I went to the gym Monday night, Tuesday night and yesterday night. I ate fairly well this week except for a small Blzzard from DQ last night. My mom started to ask if I thought I was shooting myself in the foot for eating that blizzard, but I didn't want to hear it. I am sick of eating carrot sticks. Dammit, I want ice cream, especially on a hot, humid night after I spend an hour in the gym sweating my ass off. I DESERVE that Blizzard, right? Speaking of sweating my ass off, boy, I wish that was possible. If I could lose weight by melting off my fat, I would find a friend with a car that has those heated seats and I would fry my ass. I have not always been fat. I have always been chunky. I got fat last year when I went on anti-depressant medication. Don't get me wrong, I was already overweight by that time. However, the meds have exacerbated the problem. So today for breakfast I ate some crackers and cheese, and I had a glass of 2% milk. I had a sandwich for lunch and didn't eat (except for 2 pretzel rods) until supper. I feel pretty good about my day up until that point. I ate two cheeseburgers. But I did eat 3 oz of baby carrots. But then I ate 2 giant cookies. I didn't have time to go to the gym today b/c I had to go to practice at church after supper. Oh well. Tomorrow is another day. Well, that is enough for today.

Much thanks to LadyEd for supplying this link: urlLink What kind of cheese are you? I am a yellow-orange, rectangle-shaped cheese. I am very popular. I have lots of zip and energy and love to jump around. I am sharp and clever, but also sometimes a little stubborn. The most widely purchased and eaten cheese in the world. Cheddar cheeses were originally made in England, however today they are manufactured in many countries all over the world. Fully cured Cheddar is a hard, natural cheese. It is shaped like a drum, 15 inches in diameter, with natural rind bound in cloth. Normally, the color of Cheddar ranges from white to pale yellow. Some Cheddars, however, have a color added, giving the cheese a yellow-orange color. Cheddar is always made from cow's milk and has a slightly crumbly texture if properly cured. If the cheese is too young, the texture is smooth. Cheddar gets a sharper taste the longer it matures. It is generally matured between 9 and 24 months. The important thing in purchasing Cheddar, is to consider the age of the cheese. Milk is heated to 86 degrees F and inoculated with a lactic starter culture. After an hour rennet is added. When the curd is firm, it is ground down to marble-sized bits which are heated to 100 degrees F. The whey is discarded and it is sliced into slabs. The curd is pressed overnight and stands for 4 days in a cool atmosphere. Unlike other well known cheeses, Cheddar's name is not protected so it has been used and abused by many producers around the world. [ Country: England || Milk: cow milk || Texture: semi-hard ]

I found the note I wrote myself about Cheetos. I was going to put it in, but it's pretty much what I posted yesterday. Well, there is this part I didn't add yesterday about how when we're kids we want to do fun things that are bad like lighting matches. Anyway, today was a strange day. I was up late last night working on a project for my Business Report Writing class. It got to be midnight so I decided to print the thing in the morning. So then I woke up late this morning and I still had to print the project. First I had to run to the basement to get more paper for my printer. Then I ran back up to the second story to switch on my computer and wait for it to boot. It finally booted and I pulled up the document I had to print. However, my dumb printer took F O R E V E R to print. By this time, it was 7:45. I'm supposed to be at work from 7:30 to 9am. So I called in to work and said that I wouldn't come in for the 1 1/2 hours but would come in after my 9:30-10:45 class as usual. So I got to take a shower. I didn't get to take one last night. So I prettied myself up. Because the printer was still printing. And it was only 9 or 10 pages! I toddled off to school early, stopping at Walgreens for Cheetos (YES more Cheetos) and Diet Coke and string cheese. At school, I completed the Works Cited page (I couldn't finish it at home because I only used internet sources and I don't have the internet at home) and my project was complete and ready to turn in. WOO! Then, in class, the instructor introduced a new project that is due next Wednesday. At least she gave us time in class to work on it. But what is dumb about the new project is that it is a presentation we have only one week to prepare. Compare this to the project we just turned in. She gave us two weeks, and we didn't even have to get up and talk about it. Anyway, I'm at work now, stealthily typing in my blog while I should be working. Oh well. It's after 5 now, and there aren't many people left to care... Kris called around 3:30 to say hi. I told him I was going to throw things if I don't end up with an A in my LIT class. He said not to. Well I'm out of things to say for now. Maybe I'll think up some more drivel later.

So today, being new to the blog world, I was thinking about my blog, and what to write in it. And since I'm such a fat-ass foodie, my thoughts naturally turned to food. I thought about how much I love Cheetos and Diet Coke. I thought about pizza and tacos. I even thought about vegetables. It seemed rather annoying to me that I crave things that taste good but are bad for me, and that I don't crave things that are good for me. I really don't dislike vegetables and healthy things, I just like Cheetos and tacos better. Plus, it's disturbing how much I think about food. Once I made my sister laugh: I was thinking about food again, and I said out loud, "I don't like chicken with bones." My sister exploded with laughter, and I was startled, because I hadn't realized I'd spoken out loud. She still makes fun of me because of that.

Waiting for class to begin... It's nice to have a few minutes to sit and relax. My life seems so full and busy. I love going to school. And work, while annoying sometimes, is rather fulfilling. I just wish I could go to school full time. I enjoy learning, and actually kind of like doing homework and studying. (NURD! NURD! I'm a NURD!) People ask me what career I would like to go into, and I would like to have a pat answer. Honestly, a full-time, life-long student is what would make me happy. Or at least that's what I think would make me happy.

Today was Eat What you Want Day. So I did. I wanted ice cream for lunch and that is what I ate. I ate my Dairy Queen Reese's Pieces urlLink Blizzard (a medium is approximately 950 calories) as I drove around, thinking and trying to relax. The more I think about things, the more confused I get. When I try to explain how I feel, I don't feel like my true intentions come across properly. I feel like no matter how I explain my words, actions or thoughts, no one will really understand my meaning or intent. Take last night for example. I don't think that Kris will understand why I am upset, and he will probably just tell me I shouldn't be upset. Plus, I kind of brushed off the issue today on the phone. I made him think I am upset about school, which I am, but that is not really why I was crying on the phone. Maybe I don't know my boundaries...like how upset should I be? How do I know which fights to fight, and which to let lie. I don't worry too much about Kris, and I am not really afraid he will cheat on me. Mostly I am afraid of being left out of the fun. Plus I want to know what is going on...I need to be communicated with. Kris is not always the best at doing that. Last night before I went to bed, I wrote about all this in my paper journal, in the hopes that getting things off my chest would help me fall asleep without stewing. It worked, but today, last night is mostly what I thought of. I am trying to be a good girlfriend. I don't want Kris to think he is pussy-whipped; I don't want Kris to be pussy-whipped. I don't want him to think he needs to clear his schedule with me, but if he tells me to call him before I come over, and when I call him he doesn't answer or leave me a message that he has made other plans, I feel hurt. I feel like he doesn't always respect me, my time, and the sacrifices I sometimes make to spend time with him. I don't mind making sacrifices for Kris, or doing things for him. Its just that I expect sacrifices made for me in return. I have cut class for him plenty times, and skimped on homework so we could spend time together. I don't think he has done that for me. I don't know if Kris would understand all this. He is very understanding and supportive, but maybe all this only makes sense to me. I know Kris loves me, and I love him. This is just another urlLink bump in the road.

Today's topic du jour was not the transfer of power in Iraq. No, it was not the latest on Jack Ryan's aborted Senate race. Today, we were all abuzz about an earthquake rating a 4.5 on the Richter scale. This morning, at around 1:10am CST, an earthquake, well, quaked. I was still wide awake. My brother had just come home, so when things in my room started rattling, I thought he was moving furniture or something. However, the rattling increased and continued for about 10-15 seconds. I said to myself, "An earthquake! No, this is Illinois. We don't get earthquakes (a fallacy, obviously). Well, it must have been an explosion. But I have been wide awake for some time, and I did not hear any explosion. The shaking feels like someone hit our house with a car. But I did not hear any crash. It must be an earthquake. How odd." Of course, all this took place in the aforementioned 10-15 seconds. Well, turns out I was right about the earthquake. Those of you reading my blog out in California (if anyone reads this, I will die laughing because NO ONE could possibly be interested in my boring blog) must be laughing your pants off right now. Send pictures. No. Don't. And don't laugh at me for freaking over a 4.5 earthquake. This midwesterner has never felt an earthquake before. Oh well...on to another topic...hmm...fresh topic...Ok, well off to bed!

What a whirlwind! Here's the breakdown: Friday night: I went out to the Winner's Circle bar out in Sycamore to hang out with Jenny and Joyce. I drank too much and I ate too much popcorn. Saturday morning: I woke up early and took the train in to the city. I stopped at McDonald's to get the boys some breakfast. Kris, Noel, Mike (Noel's friend from Tampa) and I ended up hanging out at Andy's condo for a while. His roommate Danny is hilarious. He tells the funniest stories in the funniest way. Saturday afternoon: Since it was raining like it was the end of the world, we took a cab to the Hilton Towers (that was the surprise I didn't guess! How awesome is that?!) and dried off in our room (on the Executive Level, no less!) then went down to eat in the restaurant. So, the Executive Level thing was pretty cool. Kris said he didn't even ask to be put on the Executive Level, but he figured that the hotel personnel decided he deserved to be there. Anyway, the EL privilege treated us to free hors d'oeuvres and breakfast the next morning. Plus, we had a lake-view room. The room was very posh, and had two beds and two bathrooms. Saturday night: When the rain let up, we walked down to the Taste. We met up with Tom, Ed, Sean, Pete, Mike, Roger and Karen and drank a lot of beer. A lot . We even got some free beers!! Woo hoo! The fireworks were awesome this year. Last year, the fireworks were lame, and the show didn't last long. But this year, the quality was excellent and the show lasted a long time. We had some more beers, then the whole group kind of split up. Kris and I slipped up to the room for some alone time. Afterwards, we were hungry, so we went back to the restaurant we'd eaten at earlier for a late night snack. When we finished, Kris and I wanted to head back up to the room...but when we got to the bank of elevators, we saw Tom with some girl we didn't know, and boy, was he puttin the mack on her! They were waiting for an elevator to go up, so we detoured to some comfy chairs; we sat and chatted until we saw Tom and the girl walk past us. When the coast was clear, Kris and I made our way back up to the room. That is when things got fuzzy for me. People came and went. Some obnoxious girls showed up with Sean and Mike, but left after proclaiming us to be L-A-M-E lame. I eventually fell asleep. Sunday morning: I woke up to at least four other guys in the room, besides my boyfriend. I was too tired and hungover to care who saw me in my bra and panties. We were all kind of out of it. We partook of the free breakfast, then collected our things and checked out. Kris and I went back to his apartment with Noel and Mike. Sunday afternoon: Kris and I wandered around the city with Noel and Mike before they had to fly back to Florida. We stopped in to eat at Mr. Greek's. We walked past the Sears Tower and just roamed. The four of us ended up near the Taste, and sat down in a secluded area to smoke. We sent Noel and Mike back to Florida, then Kris and I took a nap before we left for Wrigleyville. Sunday night: We rode a VERY crowded train up north to Wrigley Field. Kris and I met up with Tom, Ed, Sean and Pete and went in to find our seats. Our seats were in the next to last row of the upper deck! Pretty far from the action, but we had a great view. Unfortunately, the Sox lost. Since Kris, Ed and I were wearing Sox gear, we got heckled a little bit. But we shook it off, and went to hide in a bar a bit away from the park. After a few drinks at the Blarney Stone, we met up with Ed's friend at Casey Moran's. Kris and I only had one drink apiece there, then headed back to his apartment. Monday morning: Kris and I woke up around 9:30. He fell back asleep, but I was wide awake and played some games on his computer. We took a train back to the suburbs, and floated in the pool for a while. Craig joined us, and the three of us soaked in the hot tub for a while. Kris wasn't feeling 100%, so I went to get him some medicine. Later, we made pancakes for supper. Yum! Tuesday afternoon: Kris called me around 3:30 today. He was feeling even worse than yesterday, and the doctor he'd gone to sent him to the emergency room. So I told him to call and keep me updated. When I left work at 5, I went shopping to try to relax, but I was concerned about Kris. I drove past his parents' house, but his mom's car was gone, so I went on to Central DuPage Hospital, and tracked them down. Basically, the doctor still doesn't know what exactly is wrong, and why. So they are keeping him at least overnight, until some specialists can see him. So I stayed with him and his mother until 10. Then I stopped at Wendy's so I could finally eat! So you see, it has been a whirlwind of activity, and I hope this coming weekend will be much calmer!
